result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J. LEU was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess THC w/Intent to Deliver(<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Fifteen (15) days, up front, under the Huber Law.  Transfer to Calumet County Jail is authorized.  
Fifteen (15) days, stayed, to be imposed upon the discretion of the agent.

Settlement Conference Summary. Next Settlement Conference scheduled for 09-26-2014 @ 2:00 p.m.
Plea hearing is set for 10-02-2014 @ 11:00 a.m. BR-3.

Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover letter.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 08-19-14 at 4:00 p.m.  Plea date is set for 10-02-14 at 11:00 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.
Waiver of preliminary hearing is reset to 07-17-14 at 1:25 p.m.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 07-14-14 at 3:30 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC, possess THC with intent to deliver and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-09-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
